description.title: Weekly Goals
description.description: Achieve consistent accuracy above 85% on the most challenging Reading & Writing and Math question types, especially in Boundaries, Inferences, and Linear Equations. Reduce repeat errors by identifying and correcting patterns in Command of Evidence and Right Triangles problems. Strengthen reasoning speed and endurance to complete full-length tests under timed conditions with minimal score variance. Build confidence in applying strategies under pressure and maintain mental control throughout extended practice sessions.

description.title: Reading & Writing
description.description: Boundaries, Inferences, Command of Evidence - Quantitative, Central Ideas and Details, Cross-text Connections

description.title: Math
description.description: Linear equations in one variable, One-variable data: Distributions and measures of center and spread, Right triangles and trigonometry, Ratios, rates, proportional relationships, and units

description.Boundaries: Engage in timed sentence correction drills using interactive flashcards that present run-ons, comma splices, and fragments; rewrite each sentence aloud to reinforce natural pauses and proper punctuation, tracking progress with a visual timer to build focus in short bursts.
description.Inferences: Practice active reading with paired passages where you annotate clues and tone shifts, then answer inference questions in a gamified quiz format with immediate feedback, using a study buddy to discuss reasoning and deepen understanding.
description.Command of Evidence - Quantitative: Analyze SAT-style passages containing graphs and tables by highlighting key data points and paraphrasing their meaning aloud, then answer evidence-based questions under timed conditions, using a habit tracker to monitor accuracy and speed improvements.
description.Central Ideas and Details: Summarize short passages by writing central ideas and supporting details in your own words, then compare with a peer or tutor to refine understanding; use interactive tools to create visual maps linking main ideas to details.
description.Cross-text Connections: Use graphic organizers like Venn diagrams to compare paired passages, then complete timed synthesis questions that require integrating information, followed by group discussions or recorded reflections to solidify connections.

description.Linear equations in one variable: Solve multi-step linear equations and inequalities through interactive problem sets that include immediate solution checks and require verbal explanation of each step to a study partner, using a visual timer to maintain focus and speed.
description.One-variable data: Distributions and mea: Interpret box plots and histograms by calculating mean, median, range, and IQR from sample data sets in a gamified quiz format, with progress tracked visually and brief storytelling prompts to contextualize data scenarios.
description.Right triangles and trigonometry: Practice right triangle problems by drawing and labeling diagrams, then solving for unknown sides or angles using sine, cosine, and tangent on timed digital exercises that reward accuracy and speed, paired with peer review sessions.
description.Ratios, rates, proportional relationship: Work through multi-step word problems involving ratios and unit conversions using interactive flashcards and real-world scenarios, explaining your reasoning aloud to an accountability partner to reinforce understanding and maintain engagement.

description.title: Weekly Structure
description.description: Each weekday focuses on dual-skill practice pairing one Math and one Reading & Writing skill, starting Monday with the weakest areas like Boundaries and Linear Equations to build foundational accuracy. Midweek shifts to moderate skills such as Command of Evidence and One-variable data to deepen reasoning and speed. Fridays are dedicated to comprehensive review of errors and strategy refinement. Saturdays feature two full-length, timed practice tests simulating real exam conditions to build endurance and confidence, followed by detailed mistake analysis and reflection. Sunday serves as a Flex Day for rest, reflection, and adaptive practice aligned with personal energy and focus.

description.title: Flex Day Activities
description.description: Engage in low-pressure, persona-aligned activities such as reviewing errors through storytelling formats to creatively reframe mistakes and lessons learned. Experiment with new interactive tools like educational games or visual timers to discover fresh ways to maintain focus. Challenge yourself with mixed-skill quizzes that incorporate both Math and Reading & Writing in playful formats. Incorporate mindfulness exercises or light physical activity to reset cognitive energy. Set clear, motivating goals for the upcoming week, celebrating small wins to sustain enthusiasm and momentum.
